definition: to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: They love to run about on the beach.
sentences.chinese: 他們喜歡在海灘上跑來跑去。

sentences.english: Seahorses like to live in shallow waters amongst the seaweed and eelgrass.
sentences.chinese: 海馬喜歡住在海藻或鰻草叢中的淺海。

sentences.english: Too many magazines like to feature sleek models on the cover.
sentences.chinese: 太多的雜誌喜歡用時尚模特兒作封面。

sentences.english: You may vote who sever side you like.
sentences.chinese: 你可以投票選你喜歡的任一方。

sentences.english: With all the variety and adventure, Able Seaman Green said she enjoyed her work.
sentences.chinese: 面對變化和冒險，二等兵格林說她非常喜歡她的工作。

sentences.english: I prefer to use debit card when shop on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 我通常喜歡用提款卡在網上購物。

sentences.english: If you don't like the weather at front window, see the weather at back window. (
sentences.chinese: 如果你不喜歡前窗的天氣，不妨看看後窗的。
老闆喜歡認真工作的員工。

sentences.english: As a matter of fact, Edward was very fond of cooking and foodstuff.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，愛德華非常喜歡烹飪和食品。

sentences.english: PSF: You prefer doing your work on your own in your studio?
sentences.chinese: 你喜歡自己一個人在錄音棚裏搗鼓嗎？

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡和朋友們聚在一起，離開城市的喧囂。
大家都不喜歡看到紅色。

sentences.english: I also love classical literature, and Cao Xueqin is one of my favorite authors.
sentences.chinese: 我還喜歡古典文學，曹雪芹是我最喜歡的作家之一。

sentences.english: I also love classical literature, and Cao Xueqin is one of my favorite authors.
sentences.chinese: 我還喜歡古典文學，曹雪芹是我最喜歡的作家之一。

definition: only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to fall in love with/to be in love with

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
improbable/unlikely/will not (act, happen etc)/not able/not having learned to do sth/(coll.) (Tw) don't mention it/not at all
